info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 6:10AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Haywood and southwestern Madison Counties through 645 AM CDT... At 610 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mercer, or 10 miles east of Brownsville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Bemis, Hillville, Mercer, Medon, Neely, Malesus, Parkburg, Huntersville, Westover, Madison Hall, Uptonville, Denmark, Leighton and East Union. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
